Sequence Information.Peptide Name: TP3 (Tilapia piscidin 3; His-rich; natural AMPs; fish, animals; probably inactive: TP1, TP2, and TP5 MIC >17.64-23.57 ug/ml)

Literature Information.Literature: TP3 was related to O. niloticus dicentracin-like peptide (97% identity).Activity: Active against Gram-negative V. vulnificus 204 (MIC 2.44 ug/ml), A-hydrophila BCRC 13018 (MIC>19.55 ug/ml), V. alginolyticus (MIC 2.44 ug/ml), P-aeruginosa ATCC 19660 (MIC>19.55ug/ml), Gram-positive bacteria S. agalactiae 819 (MIC 9.78 ug/ml), E. faecalis BCRC 10066 (MIC 19.55 ug/ml), and S. agalactiae BCRC 10787 (MIC: 0.61 ug/ml).Toxicity:  fish erythrocytes, HC50 ~100 ug/ml, less hemo.lytic.Animal model:mouse:  TP3 showed protection against MRSA infection in mice (Huang HN et al., 2015). MOA:anti-tumor: TP3 can induce mitochondria-modualted intrinsic apoptosis of Osteosarcoma Cells (Yuan et al., 2020).  Updated 5/2015; 6/2020; 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Peng KC, Lee SH, Hour AL, Pan CY, Lee LH, Chen JY.2012
Literature Information.Title: Five Different Piscidins from Nile Tilapia, Oreochromis niloticus: Analysis of Their Expressions and Biological Functions
